titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Barbara Fenner Sjostrom scrapbook pages
titlestmt.author: Jenny Johnson

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Photographs on two scrapbook pages (front and back) of student travels in Italy and Greece.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Barbara Fenner Sjostrom scrapbook pages (SCM0419). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Barbara Fenner Sjostrom earned an A.B. in Psychology from Stanford University in 1971. She began work as a mental health counselor for Winnebago County in Rockford in 1971. She continued as a social worker as well as a volunteer for many local agencies and organizations. She earned a master's degree in public administration from Northern Illinois U. at De Kalb. She conducted research on Multiple Sclerosis at the U. of Illinois Medical School. She died in 2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs on two scrapbook pages (front and back). Images include one group photograph of students in Italy, several photographs of fellow students, a page about Stavros Mellissinos "Poet-Sandalmaker of Athens," and one photograph take in Lindhos, Greece.
